Class Console

java.lang.Object
org.example.ui.Console
public class Console extends Object
Console-based user interface for interacting with the social network application. Provides menu-driven operations for managing users, friendships, and social network analytics.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addDuckToFlock()
    Adds a duck to a specified flock.
    void
    addEvent()
    Adds a new event with type and name.
    void
    addFlock()
    Adds a new flock with the given name and type.
    void
    addFriendship()
    Prompts for two user IDs and creates a friendship between them.
    void
    addLaneToEvent()
    Adds a lane to a race event.
    void

    Adds a participant (duck) to a race event.
    void

    Adds a spectator to a specified event.

    Prompts the user to input information and adds a new Person or Duck.

    Displays the event menu options to the console.

    void
    removeUser()
    Prompts the user for a user ID and removes the corresponding user and all their friendships.
    void
    run()
    Starts the interactive console loop, allowing the user to select menu options and perform corresponding actions.
    void
    showLaneDetails()
    Displays the details of lanes associated with a specific race event.
    void
    showNumberOfCommunities()
    Displays the number of communities in the social network.
    void
    showTheMostSociableCommunity()
    Displays the most sociable community, i.e., the community with the largest diameter.

    Starts a race event and displays results.

    • getInstance

      public static Console getInstance(UserService userService, FriendshipService friendshipService, FlockService flockService, EventService eventService)

    • menu

      public void menu()
      Displays the main menu of the application.

    • flockMenu

      public void flockMenu()
      Displays the flock menu options to the console.

    • eventMenu

      public void eventMenu()
      Displays the event menu options to the console.

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the interactive console loop, allowing the user to select menu options and perform corresponding actions.

    • addUser

      public void addUser()
      Prompts the user to input information and adds a new Person or Duck. All exceptions are caught and printed to the console.

    • removeUser

      public void removeUser()
      Prompts the user for a user ID and removes the corresponding user and all their friendships. All exceptions are caught and printed to the console.

    • listUsers

      public void listUsers()
      Displays all users in the system.

    • addFriendship

      public void addFriendship()
      Prompts for two user IDs and creates a friendship between them. All exceptions are caught and printed to the console.

    • removeFriendship

      public void removeFriendship()
      Prompts for a friendship ID and removes the corresponding friendship. All exceptions are caught and printed to the console.

    • listFriendships

      public void listFriendships()
      Displays all friendships in the system.

    • showNumberOfCommunities

      public void showNumberOfCommunities()
      Displays the number of communities in the social network.

    • showTheMostSociableCommunity

      public void showTheMostSociableCommunity()
      Displays the most sociable community, i.e., the community with the largest diameter. If there is no such community, prints a message accordingly.

    • addFlock

      public void addFlock()
      Adds a new flock with the given name and type.

    • removeFlock

      public void removeFlock()
      Removes a flock by ID.

    • listFlocks

      public void listFlocks()
      Lists all flocks in the system.

      Adds a duck to a specified flock.

      public void removeDuckFromFlock()
      Removes a duck from a specified flock.

      Adds a new event with type and name.
